definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

sentences.english: Liquidity risk is the risk of not being able to meet commitments due to a shortage of cash.
sentences.chinese: 周转风险是指因缺乏现金而不能支付承付款项的风险。

sentences.english: Commitments that are material in amount should be disclosed in notes to the financial statements.
sentences.chinese: 金额较大的承付款项应在财务报表的附注中揭示。

sentences.english: L/C to allow T/T reimbursement upon payment maturity.
sentences.chinese: 允许承付到期时以电汇形式支付所承付之款项。

sentences.english: L/C to allow T/T reimbursement upon payment maturity.
sentences.chinese: 允许承付到期时以电汇形式支付所承付之款项。

sentences.english: a. When an issuing bank determines that a presentation is complying, it must honour.
sentences.chinese: 当开证行确定交单相符时，必须承付。

definition: to defer payment/to pay back over long term
to accept (i.e. acknowledge as calling for payment) (commerce)/to honor (a check, a promise)

pinyin: bu4 ke3 che4 xiao1 xin4 yong4 zheng4

definition: to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
